name: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps
mapping: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps Default Mappings
description: This plugin is used to ingest events data (Application and Page) to the Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps platform. This plugin provides support for the ingestion of JSON and CEF formatted logs.

configuration.label: Portal URL
configuration.description: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps portal URL, in which the traffic logs are to be ingested. (exclude http(s)://).

configuration.label: Authentication Method
configuration.description: The authentication method used to access the Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps.

configuration.label: Tenant ID
configuration.description: Tenant ID of your Azure application. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Client ID
configuration.description: Client ID of your Azure application. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Client Secret
configuration.description: Client Secret of your Azure application. It is required only if the 'OAuth 2.0 (Application context)' method is selected.

configuration.label: API Token
configuration.description: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps portal's API token for authentication. It is required only if the 'Legacy Method (API Token)' method is selected.

configuration.label: Data Source
configuration.description: The data source in which the traffic logs are to be uploaded from CLS.
